comments:
I get a compiler ABORT exception when using Ant in Eclipse to build some basic
aspect code. When running the same Ant script from the command line (i.e.
outside of Eclipse) everything works okay. My Ant script is as follows:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project basedir=".." name="aspectj-test" default="compile" >
    
    <!-- the aspectj compiler definition -->
    <taskdef resource="org/aspectj/tools/ant/taskdefs/aspectjTaskdefs.properties">
        <classpath>
            <pathelement location="./libs/aspectjtools.jar"/>
        </classpath>
    </taskdef>
    
    <target name="init">
        <mkdir dir="./build/classes"/>
    </target>
    
    <target name="compile" depends="init">
        <iajc destdir="./build/classes" 
              sourceroots="./src" classpath="./libs/aspectjrt.jar">
        </iajc>
    </target>
</project>

The message from the compiler is as follows:

        [iajc] ABORT
        [iajc] Exception thrown from AspectJ 1.1.1
        [iajc] 
        [iajc] This might be logged as a bug already -- find current bugs at
        [iajc]  
http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/buglist.cgi?product=AspectJ&component=Compiler
        [iajc] 
        [iajc] Bugs for exceptions thrown have titles File:line from the top stack, 
        [iajc] e.g., "SomeFile.java:243"
        [iajc] 
        [iajc] If you don't find the exception below in a bug, please add a new bug
        [iajc] at http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/enter_bug.cgi?product=AspectJ
        [iajc] To make the bug a priority, please include a test program
        [iajc] that can reproduce this exception.

org/aspectj/ajdt/internal/compiler/lookup/AjLookupEnvironment, method:

This is a known bug in the eclipse ant support.  See bug 34246 for more 
details.
You might want to submit this as a bug or enhancement request for the ajde 
eclipse IDE project.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 34246 ***
